Job Description: We have an amazing opportunity to build dream vacations and business travel with major vendors such as Expedia, Disney, Universal, Carnival Cruises, Sandals, Delta and many more Online!* Full training provided* No experience necessary* Discounted or free travel* Flexible Schedule* Full Time or Part Time Requirements* Must have computer and/or cell phone* You must be comfortable working with minimal supervision* Must enjoy helping people* Positive Attitude**Earn complimentary bonuses**Earn complimentary theme park tickets**Earn complimentary cruise ticketsPay Frequency:*Two to Three times a month*Job Description outline:*Arrange Travel for businesses, sports teams, vacations, Weddings and more*Determine customer's needs and preferences, such as schedules, costs and payment plans*Plan and arrange tour packages, excursions, and day trips*Book reservations for travel, hotel, flights, rental cars, special events, honeymoons*Provide proper documentation to the clients such as, authorization forms, flights tickets, theme park tickets*Make alternative booking arrangements if changes arise before or during the trip.

Company DescriptionAt Biogen, we offer a workplace that is unique, connected, resilient and impactful. Our purpose to find cures for rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry. We are connected as a team by this shared purpose, the pride we have in our work, and the inspiration we obtain from the lives we’re changing. We are resilient as we overcome obstacles, following the science to deliver for our patients. Most of all, our work allows us to have an impact. An impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine.Job DescriptionAs the Senior Quality Associate, Business Process Excellence (BPE), you will support controlled process management and the systems used to create and store process data. Process management includes ownership, documentation, monitoring, and improvement. You will report to the Senior Manager, BPE and work closely with other BPE members in a team setting. As a key part of Biogen’s Quality Management System (QMS), BPE sits within the R&D Quality and Strategic Operations department.What You’ll DoQuality control checking (QCing) and processing documentation updates, consulting with document ownersModel processes within the Business Process Management System (BPMS)Support function and operation of Biogen R&D’s Process Owner Network (PON)Support systems such as the Electronic Document Management System (EDMS), the BPMS, and BPE SharePoint sitesParticipate in special projects as needed to support business process managementWho You AreYou love the idea of helping R&D functions to manage and improve the processes that allow us to get lifesaving medicines to patients in our highly-regulated industry. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, and enjoy working on multiple, varied tasks and learning new technologies.QualificationsRequired skills: 3+ years relevant work experience, ideally in the biotech / pharmaceutical industryWorking knowledge of Good Practice Standards (GxPs)Experience with technical writing and/or good documentation principles / best practicesProven ability to quickly learn new computer systemsAttention to detail and proven ability to support multiple small projects at one timeGood written and verbal communication skillsPreferred SkillsProcess improvement experience/knowledge preferredExperience with Aris connect designer or architect BPMS a strong plusExperience authoring SOPsAdditional InformationWhy Biogen? Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Auto req ID: 267626BRJob DescriptionThe Value Chain Analyst owns the analytical activities for the team, including collaborative, planning, forecasting and replenishment process with customers to build supply chain initiatives and efficiencies in support of ad activity, innovation or Promotional Performance Execution. Drives Maximization of store in stocksOwns collaboration between customer, sales, supply and demand planning to drive efficiencies related to predictable product flow to support customer eventsProvide business intelligence to customer to drive mutual business benefitsOwns relationship with customer replenishment department and key internal collaboration partnersDrives influence and collaboration of CAS teamOwns but not limited to Customer in stock %, Fill Rate, Forecast Accuracy, Supply Event PerformanceOwns forecasting collaboration with Customer Replenishment Manager and PepsiCo Supply Chain teams.Develop and align with customer on process improvement and/or enhancement strategies.Develops performance execution plans and owns the tracking and monitoring in order to share proactive information with Sales, Warehousing, and Transportation to ensure successful execution of eventsResponsible for providing actionable insights as needed to mitigate out of stock occurrences and other opportunities to enable SalesNot limited to Historical data analysis, current inventory levels, POS data to proactively manage store level detailsManages Customer communications for Modular Updates (Changes to Planograms/resets)Develop exit strategy for store declines or complete item pruning, minimizing write-offs or markdownsPartners with the Customer Account team in MBS to maintain the high standard of customer service for our external stakeholdersCompensation and benefits: Expected salary range is $70k - $76k Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementOther benefits, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law.Qualifications/RequirementsBA/BS degree with 2-3 plus years of experience in Order Management, Planning, Logistics, Procurement, Supply Chain, or TransportationStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt style to needs of audienceProven change agentStrong problem solving, issue resolution, influencing and prioritization skillsCritical thinking skills with analytical and continuous improvement mindsetAbility to develop and lead project teams in an agile environmentInnovation mindset with willingness to adapt and integrate new technology, processes, and ideas to drive efficiencyProficiency in MS Office suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point)SAP and Tableau experience a plusRelocation Eligible: Not Eligible for RelocationJob Type: RegularAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityOur Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. Job Title: Manager, Global Digital Marketing - Emerging Tech
Job Description: SummaryMastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.The Global Digital Marketing team leads the digital vision and strategy of Mastercard, based upon key technology, behavioral and marketing trends in support of the overall enterprise strategy, identity, brand purpose and position. The team creates, executes, and manages capabilities to drive scale, efficiency, effectiveness, and speed to market for innovations. About the Role The Manager, Global Digital Marketing supports the VP, Global Digital Marketing in defining future-thinking concepts and campaigns that reinforce the brand’s strategy, positioning, and presence, and drive consumer/business stakeholder affection in existing and emerging digital spaces.You will be responsible for leading ideation workstreams with internal and external stakeholders to form innovative concepts for experimentation, gaining buy-in from key stakeholders through confidence, clarity and creativity in presenting ideas to cross functional teams and their line manager. You will lead a cross functional, diverse, project team to execute pilots, run assessments and if relevant, develop business cases for scaled roll out with activation materials and governance for local teams.You'll be responsible for the ongoing management of successful pilots to ensure legal, compliance and data privacy measures are maintained where necessary, and you will also partner with the team Finance Director to manage the annual Global Digital Marketing team budget, including forecasts, incremental budget asks, supporting the team VPs in development business cases, PO management, and budget cadence management. Outside of this core role, Mastercard offers a comprehensive host of opportunities to be part of stretch projects across any part of the business you may want to learn more about. We also have a number of Business Resource Groups with volunteers driving our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion agenda. We are looking for someone who is curious and has a strong appetite to learn fast and have a meaningful impact. About You Passion, curiosity, and proven knowledge about emerging technologies (AI, Blockchain, Gaming, Metaverse, Web3 NFTs, CGI, 3D, etc.) and digital marketing trends around the world is a MUST HAVE.Thrive on serving as a thought-leader, providing key information and inspiration in an entertaining and digestible wayDemonstrate a propensity for innovative thinking and an entrepreneurial attitudeComfortable with ambiguityAction and goal oriented, comfortable setting and managing expectations - for yourself and othersA naturally curious and creative thinker who's comfortable with thoughtful risk taking Adept visual communicator and storyteller, able to simplify complex concepts. Comfortable with stakeholder management across cross functional teams in multiple countries Strong experience in budget management Bonus points: Understanding of the payment industry, merchant or acquirer, payment facilitator, fintech companies, developers, etc.

Flying Embers is a company that was founded in Ojai, California by a team of entrepreneurs, winemakers, musicians and surfers driven to create the best tasting, highest quality and most innovative organic alcohol drinks in the world. Flying Embers got its name when they banded together during the Thomas Fires to protect everything they had been working to build. The experience gave them the name and their drive towards a purpose beyond the brews. They established the Embers Foundation to support firefighters and first responders with 1% of all sales going directly towards Rewild, Respond and Recover efforts. We take intense pride in pushing the limits of innovation in our brewing and in building our biz. Today, Flying Embers is a national brand with strong local roots in Ventura, California. This position is based out of Denver, Colorado and is focused on celebrating the unique value of the brand to your local community.Brand Specialists are the eyes, ears and heart of the Flying Embers in their local market. Their role is to engage & educate consumers on our portfolio of products, in order to drive brand awareness, product trial and sales. They’ll support both Marketing & Sales to establish best in class execution in their market across off & on-premises accounts, brand activations & events, local partnerships & opinion-leader relationships, and more.Our Brand Specialists are magnetic self-starters with a contagious passion for the brand & possess the natural ability to engage with anyone they meet. They have deep connections in their market and endless ideas for when, where and how to authentically engage their community. They have experience identifying and executing activations through which to connect with consumers, increase brand awareness and ultimately drive rate of sale.Your RoleSupport Sales & Marketing initiatives to drive rate of sale through consumer engagement, brand building and product trialSecure, plan & execute local brand activations & events, including festivals, concerts, community events, owned brand events, accounts activations, sales promotions, etc.Ensure best-in-class execution in on & off- premise accounts to drive sales velocityIdentifying and securing new business accounts, including staff engagement/education, merchandizing, inventory/product orders, consumer engagement & activationsPerform sampling & demos at priority accountsExecute sales initiatives and new product launches via innovative campaigns and market blitzesCollect consumer data and market research to provide valuable insight into product messaging and brand differentiationLeverage national marketing initiatives and partnerships in local marketMange to a budgetDevelop partnerships with local opinion-leaders, including product drops, sampling, content developmentComplete regular recaps & reporting of in-market activity and performanceYour ExperienceMust be 21+1 year marketing-related experience preferredConnected to the local community. Able to source top notch events and introduce the brand to relevant communities, ambassadors & influential people.Approachable, energetic & engaging personality. Exceptional ability to interact and speak to all types of consumers.Passion for brand building and creative thinking/problem solvingAbility to independently manage projects and scheduleAbility to wear many hats and thrive in a fast-paced environmentExtremely organized with strong project management skills and attention to detailExcellent verbal/written communication skillsSound judgement, professional maturity and responsible decision makingAble to work flexible hours including nights, weekends, and holidaysReliable vehicle is requiredBenefitsOur benefits package is wellness focused and comprehensive. We offer a variety of benefits to meet everyone’s need:Comprehensive health and wellness coverage that covers 99% of premium costs for employees401kPaid Parental LeaveFlexible working environmentFlexible Spending Account/Commuter BenefitsGenerous and flexible vacation policyPet Insurance for your furry kidsFree personal development therapy (EAP)Equity In The CompanyCompetitive SalaryPerksFree Flying Embers!!!Company branded swagBrand partnership discounts with other local purpose driven companiesHappy hours, team-building, company-sponsored events and festivalsCasual/Creative Office EnvironmentWork EnvironmentReasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet. The lighting in the work environment may be dim. Candidate must be able to travel via car, train or airplane and attend events as needed.Physical RequirementsCandidate must be able to perform physical activities which include but are not limited to lifting, bending over, kneeling, twisting, climbing on ladders, stooping, crouching, and routinely lifting up to 50 lbs. Candidates may be required to stand and or sit for various hours at a time. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must have the physical and mental strength and endurance to be able to perform duties, as well as the ability to handle stressors of the position.

Auto req ID: 272929BRJob DescriptionThe Demand Planner contributes to PBNA South Division success by developing accurate sales forecasts. This is accomplished by leveraging data and statistical models to guide the decision making process for the assigned markets in consultation with other key process stakeholders.Key Responsibilities include:Generate weekly product forecasts Utilize demand planning exception reports to identify and correct potential issuesPerform Root Cause analysis to bridge gaps between forecast and actuals Collect promotional information from Sales and Marketing business partnersInput historical retail price and exceptions into PREVAIL systemAdjust forecasts as needed to capture local market intelligence Lead weekly Sales/Inventory and Production call (SIP) and prepare demand agenda and reporting for review Lead weekly demand and sales connect to validate market activity and volume assumptionsPerform master data maintenance to maintain accurate product and customer information Perform PREVAIL data maintenance to improve demand forecast Act as channel specific and key account divisional planner as well as lead periodic customer reviews to drive improvement on forecast accuracy metrics and minimize key account service disruptions Implement best practices across markets and divisions Assist Associate Demand Manager with ad hoc requests related to improving overall demand forecast accuracy.Compensation and Benefits:The expected salary range is 70k-75k. Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementOther benefits, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health, and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.Qualifications/RequirementsBachelor’s degree required; concentration in Engineering, Supply Chain Operations Management, Business or related field or proven experience in Supply Chain or related fieldHigh proficiency with MS Office products, particularly Excel, Word and OutlookStrong organizational, analytical and time management skillsStrong written and oral communication skills Demonstrated leadership qualitiesPrevious experience in Demand and/or Supply Planning a plus Travel = 10% - 15%Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter.Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for RelocationJob Type: RegularAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityOur Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. Business Analyst Intern will work with other business analysts in the team to conduct market analysis, analyzing both product lines and the overall profitability of the business. In addition, they develop and monitor data quality metrics and ensure business data and reporting needs are met. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits.﻿Responsibilities:Creating a detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a businessLeading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategiesStaying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systemsConducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findingsGathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reportsAllocating resources and maintaining cost efficiencyUpdating, implementing, and maintaining proceduresQualifications:Strong technology, analytical and communication skills.Good analytical and conceptual thinking skillsGood documentation skillsFundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skillsGood planning, organizational, and time management skills

10165698Who We’re Looking ForToyota’s Human Resources Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated HR Administrator.Reporting to the HR Senior Manager, the person in this role will support a growing team of HR Business Advisors (HRBAs) in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.What You’ll Be DoingMAINTAIN THE WORKDAY HRIS SYSTEM Keep the organization functioning efficiently by maintaining the Workday system. This includes making requested changes, proactively following up on missing/late approvals, and overseeing changes to completion. Lead Workday data integrity efforts by performing routine system clean-up and maintaining job profile integrity. Run reports, visualize data, and share information to support the HR Business advisors which may include reward program status, stay and exit interview data, and ad-hoc reporting requests.LEAD ALL HR ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESSES Coordinate job requisitions and job postings. Create job offer letters, transfer letters, and other job-related communications. Manage the electronic filing system with an eye on data integrity. Raise suggestions for process improvement, automation, and other ideas that enhance our team’s efficiency.PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE Provide exceptional customer service to the HR team, business leaders, and Team Members. Answer and support resolution to Team Member questions. Support and collaborate with HR Business Advisors on special projects, including the Team Member Experience Survey and ad hoc customer sentiment activity. Look for trends and raise opportunities to improve.Champion Company Programs Serve as the benefits team liaison, taking customer sentiment from the business to the benefits team, and updating the HRBA team on program changes and enhancements. Serve as the wellness program liaison, communicating program changes, enhancements, and upcoming events. Serve on employee engagement teams to coordinate teambuilding and networking events for the HR team.What You Bring Associates Degree in Business, Communications, Human Resources, or a related field. Work experience in a professional environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Exceptional customer service skills and the ability to work successfully with people at all levels. Experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where multi-tasking is required. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.). Ability and willingness to travel up to 10% of the time, possibly a higher percentage during peak periods or for critical business needs.Added bonus if you have  Experience working in Human Resources. Experience with Workday HRIS. Experience with MS Teams. Bachelor’s Degree.What We’ll BringDuring your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include: A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement. Vehicle purchase & lease programs. Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family. Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable). Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute. Paid holidays and paid time off. Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more. Flexible spending accounts. Relocation assistance (if applicable).To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

*Description:*Objective: evaluate quality of search terms across head, torso and tail (90%+ search volume) and sub-markets with the intent to find areas for improvement.Skills:*Processor, data entry, detail, quality checkTop Skills Details:*Processor,data entry,detail,quality checkAdditional Skills & Qualifications:*Attention to detail qualityExperience Level:*Intermediate LevelAbout Aston Carter:At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

Social Media & Influencer Marketing ManagerThis exciting social media and influencer management role will focus heavily on increasing brand awareness for Shoebacca and our products and generating inbound traffic through the effective use of social media outlets and corresponding web-based platforms. This role coordinates with the internal marketing & merchandising teams to support their respective missions, ensuring consistency in voice and cultivating a strong revenue driven social media presence that stands out in the market. In addition to social media, the manager will vet and coordinate qualified influencers to promote Shoebacca and our core products. The ideal candidate will be a digitally savvy, self-starter who is passionate about social media and marketing. The Social Media manager will be responsible to push engagement by creating compelling original, high-quality content for each individual platform with the highest level of frequency and optimization. The candidate must have strong writing abilities and understand the impact and execution of traditional and influencer marketing as well as digital media technologies.   CORE RESPONSIBILITIES  Develop and execute a core social media strategy designed to generate revenue and build brand awareness for the company by utilizing platforms including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube Pinterest & TikTok.Become an advocate and brand ambassador for the company in social media spaces, engaging in dialogues, monitoring activity, and answering questions where appropriateGenerate and optimize high quality digital content such as videos, reels, stories, interactive polls, stop motion, infographics, engaging posts and more using in house photography and vendor imageryCollaborate with merchandising team to identify needs, opportunities, promotions, and trends to promote through social mediaHost on and off-site shopping events utilizing social media networksCollaborate with the company’s digital marketing agency to support and amplify paid social media placements and adsAssist the overall marketing department with photography, data collection, proposals, analytics, affiliate marketing channels as well as other various marketing related tasks.Regularly analyze, review and report on the effectiveness of social media campaigns to maximize results and provide feedback and insights designed to help evolve brand strategies. Monitor trends in social media tools, tactics, trends and applicationsCultivate and execute upon a comprehensive influencer marketing strategy to drive awareness, website traffic and conversionsMonitor and Coordinate influencer activity and measure results JOB REQUIREMENTS 1-2+ years of retail experience required; retail and corporate experience preferredBachelor’s Degree in Advertising, Marketing, Social Media, Communications or related field2 years in a social media, public relations, journalism, corporate communications, or related roleFluency and working knowledge in all social channels, to include, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, Twitter & TikTokExperience with managing a company's social media presence using social media management tools such at HootSuite, Sprout Social and other related digital web applicationsAbility to generate creative media using tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Envato or other related toolsExcellent creative writing and verbal communication skillsStrong knowledge of Microsoft Office SuiteStrong project management and planning skillsKnowledge of current trends in the social media worldPassion for social media and exceeding expectations beyond the standard required social media practices

Flying Embers is a company that was founded in Ojai, California by a team of entrepreneurs, winemakers, musicians and surfers driven to create the best tasting, highest quality and most innovative organic alcohol drinks in the world. Flying Embers got its name when they banded together during the Thomas Fires to protect everything they had been working to build. The experience gave them the name and their drive towards a purpose beyond the brews. They established the Embers Foundation to support firefighters and first responders with 1% of all sales going directly towards Rewild, Respond and Recover efforts. We take intense pride in pushing the limits of innovation in our brewing and in building our biz. Today, Flying Embers is a national brand with strong local roots in Ventura, California. This position is based out of Chicago, IL and is focused on celebrating the unique value of the brand to your local community.Brand Specialists are the eyes, ears and heart of the Flying Embers in their local market. Their role is to engage & educate consumers on our portfolio of products, in order to drive brand awareness, product trial and sales. They’ll support both Marketing & Sales to establish best in class execution in their market across off & on-premises accounts, brand activations & events, local partnerships & opinion-leader relationships, and more.Our Brand Specialists are magnetic self-starters with a contagious passion for the brand & possess the natural ability to engage with anyone they meet. They have deep connections in their market and endless ideas for when, where and how to authentically engage their community. They have experience identifying and executing activations through which to connect with consumers, increase brand awareness and ultimately drive rate of sale.Your RoleSupport Sales & Marketing initiatives to drive rate of sale through consumer engagement, brand building and product trialSecure, plan & execute local brand activations & events, including festivals, concerts, community events, owned brand events, accounts activations, sales promotions, etc.Ensure best-in-class execution in on & off- premise accounts to drive sales velocityIdentifying and securing new business accounts, including staff engagement/education, merchandizing, inventory/product orders, consumer engagement & activationsPerform sampling & demos at priority accountsExecute sales initiatives and new product launches via innovative campaigns and market blitzesCollect consumer data and market research to provide valuable insight into product messaging and brand differentiationLeverage national marketing initiatives and partnerships in local marketMange to a budgetDevelop partnerships with local opinion-leaders, including product drops, sampling, content developmentComplete regular recaps & reporting of in-market activity and performanceYour ExperienceMust be 21+1 year marketing-related experience preferredConnected to the local community. Able to source top notch events and introduce the brand to relevant communities, ambassadors & influential people.Approachable, energetic & engaging personality. Exceptional ability to interact and speak to all types of consumers.Passion for brand building and creative thinking/problem solvingAbility to independently manage projects and scheduleAbility to wear many hats and thrive in a fast-paced environmentExtremely organized with strong project management skills and attention to detailExcellent verbal/written communication skillsSound judgement, professional maturity and responsible decision makingAble to work flexible hours including nights, weekends, and holidaysReliable vehicle is requiredBenefitsOur benefits package is wellness focused and comprehensive. We offer a variety of benefits to meet everyone’s need:Comprehensive health and wellness coverage that covers 99% of premium costs for employees401kPaid Parental LeaveFlexible working environmentFlexible Spending Account/Commuter BenefitsGenerous and flexible vacation policyPet Insurance for your furry kidsFree personal development therapy (EAP)Equity In The CompanyCompetitive SalaryPerksFree Flying Embers!!!Company branded swagBrand partnership discounts with other local purpose driven companiesHappy hours, team-building, company-sponsored events and festivalsCasual/Creative Office EnvironmentWork EnvironmentReasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Davnas is creating the world’s most innovative and beautiful digital displays that revolutionize the way people engage with, and appreciate digital art.Danvas is led by seasoned founders and are supported by some of the best VCs in the industry. With our new seed round we are growing our team, primarily in the Los Angeles area, but also with talented individuals who are working remotely.Danvas is looking for a Social Marketing & Community Manager who will develop and deliver our community and digital marketing strategy. This role will be primarily focus on the digital artist community, which we value as a very important contributor to, and voice in our product development process. As our community manager you will be monitoring and managing internal community spaces, including discord, and other social media channels and relaying key user feedback to management.Things that you will do:Maintain and promote a vibrant community cultureGather insights from community as well as critical issues, and relay them to leadership teamKeep informational resources up to date on product developments and community opportunities, like promotions and eventsContribute ideas and effort to our brand, content, and community strategiesProvide planning and support for IRL on-site community eventsMinimum Qualifications:Understanding of and passion for decentralized technologyAbility to effectively prioritize tasks in a rapidly shifting landscapeStrong work ethic, hustle, communication, writing ability, and business development sensibilityCommitment to excellence in brand communications.Bonus Qualifications:Experience working with cryptocurrency, blockchain, or NFT companiesUnderstanding of the art marketEstablished network in the NFT industryAn entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for using emerging technology and data to solve unmet user needsA startup friendly attitude, meaning a willingness to jump in and help in other aspects of the business’ growth as neededPlease note:As the community grows, we may need to adjust to shift-based staffing to accommodate support and questions that arrive outside of domestic timezones. Your willingness to adjust to shifts is appreciated.Your Role in Danvas Culture:At Danvas, we look for candidates who can positively contribute to a culture that values accountability, candor, kindness, character, and fun. All employees are asked to think like key stakeholders and make sound decisions, but are also encouraged to take risks so we can elevate our process and create a more innovative product. Lastly, to work at Danvas is to respect and appreciate artists, value art, and want to help artists achieve their goals, artistically and financially - this means obsessively making sure art collectors enjoy using Danvas devices so much they ultimately buy more artwork.Diversity: Danvas is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity leads to stronger teams and better decisions. We practice diversity from the ground up - regardless of your gender identity, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or nationality, you will have an equal chance of having an impact at Danvas.

Mechanical Engineer – CAD Design - Lemont, IL – 1 Year ContractOur client, Argonne National Laboratory, is looking to fill an immediate opening for a full time, Mechanical Engineer / CAD design position. Mechanical engineer will need to be able to: design, fabricate, and preform engineer analysis in support of component designs. Work site: Lemont, IL Some remote / telework may be permitted. Duties:Designs accelerator components, within guidelines from the Mechanical Engineering & Design (MED) group and the Accelerator Systems Division (ASD) project engineerCreate engineering fabrication drawings using PTC CREO (pro/Engineer)Perform engineering analysis of component designsWrite technical specifications and reports, comprehensive statements of work and prepare procurement documentationFabrication, assembly instructions, and presentations for engineering reviewsEducation and Experience Requirements:BS in Mechanical Engineering with 8 years of experience  ORMS in Mechanical engineering with 5 years of experience Required Skills:Full professional proficiency with PTC CREO (pro/Engineer) modeling and drawing creating as well as familiarity with AutoCAD.Solid ability to use engineering analysis software such as ANSYS or COMSOL MultiphysicsConsiderable knowledge of manufacturing techniques and Geometric dimensioning and tolerance (GD&T) principles.Technical writing skills and is able to relay technical information in writing reports, specifications, and statements of work.Preferred Skills:Particle accelerator and/or x-ray beamline experience is a plus.If you or anyone you know of is interested in this position, please email all resumes to us for immediate consideration.

Training and experimenting with machine learning models to automate and optimize Freshworks' products.Implementing machine learning platform features for customizability, scalability, and extensibility.Solving complex problems with structured or unstructured datasets and deploying the solution through cloud platforms.Documenting and testing machine learning processes.Performing statistical analysis and interpreting the result.QualificationsPursuing Masters in Engineering, Math, Business, or comparable technical concentration Ability to manage simultaneous tasks and deliverables in a fast-paced, globally-integrated, technology-oriented environment with autonomy to drive towards business goals without an obvious path to successComfortable presenting data and related insights to leadersYou are a  highly driven individual with a deep desire to learn.Experience collaborating cross-functionally (e.g. Biz Apps, Sales, Marketing, Finance) to identify and solve common data issues, develop operational steps in improving data cleanliness, and align on data definitions and related informationAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. Position Overview:This position will research, plan, design and develop mechanical products and systems in support of operations and customers. They will serve as an engineering interface between design, assembly, manufacturing, and customer. This position will also provide technical support for operations, including material review board, and program management, to ensure customer satisfaction and product development. They will be responsible for making minor changes or enhancements in systems and processes to solve problems, improve effectiveness and eliminate malfunctions, reduce cost, and incorporate new customer requirements .Employees who are working in Hybrid roles will work regularly both onsite and offsite. Ratio of time working onsite will be determined in partnership with your leader. Regardless of your role type, collaboration and innovation are critical to our business and all employees will have access to digital tools so they can work with colleagues around the world – and access to Collins sites when their work requires in-person meetings.Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.At Collins Aerospace, our Interiors team is focused on innovation, safety and cost efficiency. But we don’t just get people from point A to point B. We’re committed to making air travel more comfortable, connected and secure. As a leader in aviation interior products and services, we’re helping airlines and original equipment manufacturers create a positive experience for their customers. With offices and manufacturing facilities in more than 12 states across the U.S. and more than 10 countries around the globe, we’re changing the game of aircraft interiors. Are you ready to join our team?Primary Responsibilities: Design ownership of product life-cycle during serial production, including product support and customer technical interface.  Design mechanical components and assemblies with an emphasis on manufacturability, reliability and maintainability.  Perform engineering calculations to determine the size and strength of components. Solve design problems and check computations contributing to analytical designs.  Prepare, modify and release drawings created in CAD (Unigraphics) to verify fit, form and function of mechanical designs.  Verify structural acceptability of designs by testing prototypes for reliability and FAA certification through dynamic/static testing.  Utilize engineering tools such as FMEAs, FEA, and DFMA to validate design content.  Evaluate materials and parts for use in designs including communicating with current and new suppliers.  Work with Mechanical Engineering and operations to troubleshoot issues with existing product.  Operate in a team environment with other functional areas providing input to design solutions and participate in design reviews. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree OR i n absence of a degree, 6 years of relevant experience is required Must be U.S Citizen Preferred qualifications: Prior experience in the design of mechanical systems for commercial aircraft seating products is a plus.  Experience working with Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DFMA) principles.  Familiarity with FAA requirements a plus.  Strong customer skills and customer focus (both internal and external customers)  Strong analytical skills  Excellent written and verbal skills  Experience at troubleshooting including in depth root cause analysis and corrective action closure Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.At Collins Aerospace, our Interiors team is focused on innovation, safety and cost efficiency. But we don’t just get people from point A to point B. We’re committed to making air travel more comfortable, connected and secure. As a leader in aviation interior products and services, we’re helping airlines and original equipment manufacturers create a positive experience for their customers. With offices and manufacturing facilities in more than 12 states across the U.S. and more than 10 countries around the globe, we’re changing the game of aircraft interiors. Are you ready to join our team?Collins Aerospace Diversity & Inclusion Statement:Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.Some of our competitive benefits package includes:Medical, dental, and vision insuranceThree weeks of vacation for newly hired employeesGenerous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy optionEmployee Scholar Program, tuition reimbursement programLife insurance and disability coverageOptional coverages you can buy: Pet Insurance, Home and Auto, additional life insurance, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal Ovia Health, fertility and family planning Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 5 free counseling sessions Incentives for a Healthy YouBright Horizons, back-up child / elder care and college coach resourcesAutism BenefitDoctor on Demand, virtual doctor visitsAdoption AssistanceTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programAnd more!Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen. Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.) Drug Screen only performed on re-hires who have been gone for more than 1 yearAt Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again.Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day.

** WARNING: Typical of a Silicon Valley startup, we are not for the faint of heart. This is not a typical internship either. Full-time role only with work from Maui/HI+San Francisco/CA **Robometrics® Machines (a Skive it® company) is getting humanity back into AI, making machines more humans and hoping to make humans less like machines. We are an Autonomous AI chip company enabling machines to feel and looking for marketing, content creator and business development super stars. Primary job is market, financial research and business analytics. Secondary role will be to help the executive team with social media marketing, business development, and content creation that entails applying AI to aerospace and healthcare verticals. We are also open to exceptional interns. Reach out (jobs@skive.it)Think strategically about improving company operationsCompile data into actionable reportsPrepare pitch and presentation materialsFull-time. 6 months+You should only apply if you can start in the next few days if selected - a month for us is the same as a year in other companies. This is *not* your typical 9-5pm job. We values include 996 work culture, aim for perfection, chase 10X and not 10%, win as a team and extreme ownership. Qualification Financial college graduate in finance, investment banking, management consulting, private equity, corporate development, or market research. Other majors are welcomed to apply as long as they can show experience and aptitude.Candidates should be very detail-oriented, strong researchers, enjoy finance, demonstrated ability to work hard, intelligent and curiousExcellent Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) skillsAnalytic and quantitative skills needed to review financial and market projections, balance sheets, and operating plans of potential and existing investmentsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsDetails on who we hire and what to expect. https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/we-hiring-aditya-mohan/Questions? jobs@skive.it The CultureRobometrics® Machines is getting humanity back into AI, making machines more humans and hoping to make humans less like machines. We like people who are crazy enough to think differently; the round pegs in the square holes... the ones who see things differently. Who consider themselves as being super cool and don't mind been seen as the crazy ones. A passion to create innovative products is an absolute must. "The only way to do great work is to love what you do" — Steve Jobs Work culture include: It is OK to be 25% wrong and take risks. Learn by failing 1 out of 4 times [only]. Aim for perfection - All or NothingChase 10X and not 10%Just do it - As one of our founders who worked at MIT Media Labs says “Deploy!”. Write instead of just talk, build, prototype and deploy instead of just write. Win as a team Extreme ownership Robometrics® Machines (a Skive it® company) expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Skive it® is an equal opportunity employer.The Benefits An early spot at a fast-growing company that is changing the future of AI and autonomous machines. Opportunity to work in a product focused environment to create the world’s first machines that can feel. A huge level up in your experience. We’ll make sure you see a lot of growth in your skill set that helps you to accelerate your career. Being part of a small startup team, an opportunity to work across multiple parts of the value chain in an industry starting with Aerospace, autonomous cars and healthcare. Opportunity to work with and connect with Skive it® founders, executive team and advisory board that are industry visionaries and thought leaders. Compensation, benefits, equity, and salary that are above industry average once the current funding round closes. Compensation mentioned on this post are future estimates.Currently, 100% remote work that will ensure that you can maintain work-life balance even when working long hours (Yes, we do believe in ‘996’ work culture)Participate in annual team retreat. Once a year the entire Skive it® team gets together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play hard.Unlimited Vacation. We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.We thank all applicants for their interest.
